Package main

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
main.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
This class store a ObjectsList for different types of objects simulating the inventory of a character. The main methods are addToInventory(item) and removeFromInventory(item).
Author:
Fernando Tarrino del Pozo (FernandoEsra)

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      This constructor create a new empty ObjectsList.

  • Method Details

    • addToInventory

      public void addToInventory(Object item)
      This method add a object at the end of the inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - A new object to add to the inventory

    • removeFromInventory

      public boolean removeFromInventory(Object item)
      Parameters:
      item - A object to remove from the inventory, if exists inside the inventory.
      Returns:
      true if the object exists in the inventory ant its possible to delete, then delete the object.
      False if the item its not in the inventory.

    • searchForName

      public boolean searchForName(String nameToSearch)
      Search one object in the inventory using the name attribute. This method only work with base.Resource objects. Important: This method only reads the first occurrence of the searched object name. If more objects exists, this method dont read this objects.
      Parameters:
      nameToSearch - The name attribute (not the class name) for the object being searched.
      Returns:
      true if the object exists inside the inventory, False if not.

    • fetchForName

      public Object fetchForName(String nameToFetch)
      This method return a Resource object that matches the nameToFetch. If no one object of the searche name exists, return null. Important: This method only reads the first occurrence of the searched object name. If more objects exists, this method dont read this objects.
      Parameters:
      nameToFetch - The name attribute (not the class name) for the object being searched.
      Returns:
      If one object with the searched name exists, return that object. If not, return null.
